{ "step_by_step_thinking": "A custom tray is indeed easier to adapt to the patient's mouth, which makes it a better choice for taking impressions for a crown. A stock tray may not record the full flange, which can lead to inaccuracies in the impression. A stock tray can also distort easily, which can affect the accuracy of the impression. However, a custom tray is not cheaper than a stock tray. Custom trays are made specifically for each patient, which requires more time and materials, making them more expensive.", "answer_choice": "C" }
